meanings.definition: A person who learns the part of another in order to act as a substitute if needed.
meanings.sent1: The understudies in the play practiced their lines diligently.
meanings.sent2: During the performance, the understudies were ready to step in if the main actors got sick.
meanings.sent3: The understudies joked backstage about secretly wanting the lead role.
meanings.sent4: In the theater of life, we are all understudies waiting for our moment in the spotlight.
meanings.sent5: The understudies observed the main actors closely to mimic their gestures and expressions.

meanings.definition: To study or learn the part of another in order to act as a substitute if needed.
meanings.sent1: She quickly understudies the role of the princess in case the lead actress falls ill.
meanings.sent2: The young actor understudies the veteran performer to improve his skills.
meanings.sent3: He decided to understudy his friend's presentation to surprise him with a flawless delivery.
meanings.sent4: Learning to understudy different characters helps actors become more versatile.
meanings.sent5: The student eagerly understudies the teacher's methods to become a great leader one day.
